ACT 2.—Scene 1.

has attended the representation of

T h e BARBER of SEVILLE, a n d T h e BRIDE of LUDGATE,

those Fnie~e* will be performed three times a week for the present, and the production of
the Mew Comedy of

LORDS A N D COMMONS,

is therefore postponed until Tuesday, December 2Qth.

T H E LATE MISS MORDAUNT
Having been received with the utmost enthusiasm, by a full and fashionable audience,
In Zephyrina, will perform that character and Jlliss Hardcattle, this Evening; and
Helen, in the Hunchback, To-morrow.
Mr.
P O W E R
Having, on his 3rd Appearance at this Theatre, been hailed with shouts of laughter and
applause, from the commencement to the termination of his performance, will appear
every Evening until further notice.
Mr.
S T A N L E Y
Was received on Monday with great favour, in the Character of Romeo, and will perform Modus, in The Hunchback, To-morrow, and in the New Tragedy on Monday next.

The following1 is an Illustration of the Scenic Objects of

The Pageant .
SCENE I., represents a

YIEW OF ARROTSFORD,
TUS SEAT OF THE LATE

SIR TFALTER
SCOW.
FAINTED BY MR. STANFIELD.
A Procession of the Dramatic Characters his genius has created (and led by
the LAST MINSTREL) perform a Pilgrimage to Abbotsford,
IN THE FOLLOWING ORDER:

Rainier, WAVERLEY.
The Baron of Bradwardine conducts Captain Waverley and Rose Bradwardine: be joins their hands
and blesses them—a troop of Scotch Archers follow, and muffled drums are heard—Guards conduct
Fergus M'lvor to execution, followed by Flora M'lvor, who carries on her arm the shroud she has
made—they embrace; he cheers her; fortifies his courage, and, exulting, orders the procession to
proeeed to execution.

B a n n e r , FORTUNES OF NIGEL.
King James enters, attended by Master Heriot, the Goldsmith, and followed by Nigel, bearing a
petition, and two Pages carrying a piece of embossed plate, which the Goldsmith displays to his Majesty,
who appears gratified with it; not so with a Bplendid sword, which the Goldsmith unsheaths—this action
alarms the King's temerity; he expresses hatred of cold steel, and turns to Nigel, who, on his knee,
presents his petition—the King reads it approvingly, and proceeds. To this succeeds Trapbois, th«
Usurer, hugging his money bags, Martha Trapbois following—they are watched by two ruffians, who ar.
the guilty instruments of his murder.

B a n n e r , GUY MANNERING.
Henry Bertram and Julia Mannering, hand in hand, are followed by Meg Merrilies, as guardian
genius of the House of Bertram—Dirk Hatteraick and two Gypsies are watched by Dandie Dinmont—
the Tableau concluded by Dominie Samson.

B a n n e r , BRIDE OF LAMMERMOOR.
Colonel Ashton leads in Lucy Ashton, pale and dejected—Lady Ashton produces the marriage
eontract—the Master of Ravenswood indignantly advances—returns to Lady Ashton the piece of gold
taken from his neck, who gives to him that worn by Lucy—Caleb Balderstone attempting to soothe the
indignation of the Master of Ravenswood.

B a n n e r , ROR ROY.
Francis Osbaldistone conducts Diana Vernon—Rob Roy advances between his Sons, animated by
the gallant bearing of Helen Macgregor—Major Galbraith advances with military importance, followed
by Bailie Nicol Jarvie.

B a n n e r , IVAN HOE.
Knights in Armour, followed by Richard CcBur de Lion in martial array—then Ivanhoe and Lady
Rowena, attended, preceded by Wamba, (the Jester)—Isaac of York then leads in Rebecca—and the
Tableau is concluded by Robin Hood, Little John, Allen-a-Dale, Friar Tuck and the Merry Archers
of Sherwood Forest.

B a n n e r , T H E ANTIQUARY.
Jonathan Oldbuck introduces Miss Grizelda Oldbuck, followed by Caxton, carrying a wig and wig.
block—they are succeeded by Level and Isabella W ardour, and followed by Edie Ochiltrie.

R a n n e r , H E A R T OF MID-LOTH IA N.
Enter Queen Caroline, attended by Lady Suffolk—the Duke of Argyle following, soliciting a boon,
which being granted, he introduces Jeannie Deans, who kneels and presents a petition—graciously
received by her Majesty, who retires; and Jeannie is about to return, when Mrs. Glass brings in her
Sister, Effie Deans; they embrace—and are followed by Madge "Wildfire and the Laird of Dumbiedikes
ON HIS PONEY.

R a n n e r , P E V E R I L OF T H E P E A R .
King Charles the Second enters, in conversation with the Dukes of Buckingham and Ormond,
attended by Courtiers—among whom are the Dwarf, Sir Jeofrrey Hudson, who is welcomed by the
King—Fenella now rushes in, splendidly attired—the King is attracted by her fantastic attitudes and
obeisances—and the Tableau is concluded by the Countess of Derby, Sir Jeffrey PeverU, Major
Bridgenorth and his Daughter, Alice.

R a n n e r , LADY OF T H E L A K E .
Ellen is seen crossing in her boat, followed by Allan Bane, who beckons on Fitzjames—he is
arrested in his pursuit of her by the entrance of Blanche, who points'out to him the arrow with which
she has just been shot—Roderick Dhu enters with his Clansmen, and Fitzjames bids him mortal defiance.

R a n n e r , LEGEND OF

MONTROSE.

Dugald Dalgetty enters ON HIS WAR-HORSE, fully caparisoned—his entrance is succeeded
by that of the Earl of Menteith, leading in Annot Lyle—Allan M'Aulay, of the Red-hand, follows them,
in a threatening attitude.

R a n n e r , RENTLWORTH.
The Morrice Dancers appear, followed by the State Trumpeters and Beef-Eaters—then enter the
Queen and Earl of Leicester, preceded by Sir Walter Raleigh, who lays down his cloak for the Queen
W walk on—they are followed by Sir Richard Varney, and Servants of Leicester's household after
which, Wayland Smith leads in Amy Robsart, preceded by Flibbertygibbet as their guide.
S G. Fairbrother, Printer, Exeter Court, Strand.

Having attracted a brilliant and crowded House, and their performance being received
throughout, with the utmost approbation,
W I L L BE REPEATED T O - M O R R O W EVENING.

E§" Shakspeare's Tragedy of OTHELLO
Is in preparation, in which Mr. KEAN and Mr. M&CREADY will appear together, for
the First Time, and alternately play the characters of Othello and Iago.
In addition to the powerful Operatic Company already belonging to this Theatre, an
engagement has been concluded with the celebrated German Singer
MADAME

SCHROEDER BEVRIENT,
of whose performance the earliest intimation will be given-

Mr. BACKET,

From the New York Theatre, will make hia appearance in the course cf a few days, in
Colman's Comedy of WHO WAJVTS A GUINEA f and a New
Entertainment, written expressly for him.

DOOM

KISS.

general preparation having elicited unbounded applause from a crowded audience, will
be performed, as an Afterpiece, on Wednesday next

are respectfully informed, that the Tragedy of OTHELLO, in whieh

in the procuration of Seats, in consequence of the numerous parties tnat
have already secured them,) as early an application for Places as possible is requested.

Regulations,
for the general accommodation of the Public, have been made with the Police in attendance :—Carriages are to set down at the Portico in Brydges-street.

towards the Strand.—Carriages

Mr. K E A N and Mr. MACREADY

laving, on their Second Appearance together in Shakspeare's Tragedy
>f OTHELLO, attracted one of the most crowded audiences ever in the
Theatre, and their performance having been hailed with the loudest
acclamations, they will repeat the parts of OTHELLO and IAGO,
on Monday; and will shortly alternate their respective Characters.

Mr. KEAN and Mr. MACREADY

Having, on their Second Appearance together in Shakspeare's Tragedy
of OTHELLO- attracted one of the most crowded audiences ever in the
Theatre, and their performance having been hailed with the loudest
acclamations, they will repeat the parts of OTHELLO and I AGO,
on Monday; and will shortly alternate their respective Characters.

OTHELLO,

their performance having been hailed with the loudest acclamations,
they will repeat their celebrated parts of OTHELLO and lAGO,

Mr. KEAN and Mr. MACREADY
Having, on their Sixth Appearance together in Ghakspearc'sTragedy of

OTHELLO,

attracted one of the most crowded audiences ever in the Theatre, and
their performance having been hailed with the loudest acclamations,
thev will repeat their celebrated parts of OTHELLO and IAGO,
ON M O N D A Y N E X T ,
and will shortly afterwards alternate their respective Characters.
